description: From stem of Ancient Greek ἀφρός (aphrós, “sea foam, froth”) (for its supposed resemblance)  +‎ -ite. This coining matches not only the name of the goddess, but also the popular folk etymology for her by the Ancient Greeks.

entries.meaning: (mineralogy) A soft and earthy mineral of a white or yellowish color, and with a waxy lustre, found at Langbanshytta in Sweden. It is a hydrated silicate of magnesia, and resembles meerschaum.
